definition: to drop off/to come off/to lose (hair etc)/to omit (a character when writing)
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: Because embolus can fall off repeatedly, have a relapse easily so.
sentences.chinese: 由於栓子可以反覆脫落，所以容易復發。

sentences.english: The fenders had fallen off that old bus.
sentences.chinese: 保險槓已從那輛破舊的汽車上脫落下來。

sentences.english: There are 3 cycles of hair growth-growing, resting, and shedding.
sentences.chinese: 有3頭髮生長週期的增長，休息，和脫落。

sentences.english: Malocclusion can be related to habits such as thumb sucking or premature loss of the deciduous (milk, baby) teeth.
sentences.chinese: 錯頜畸形與一些習慣如允吸大拇指乳牙過早脫落有關。

sentences.english: Exogenous ABA has advance in these three sugars.
sentences.chinese: 外源脫落酸則對這三種糖均有促進效果。

sentences.english: Sprays of liquid nitrogen freeze and kill the abnormal tissue, which sloughs off.
sentences.chinese: 用液氮噴灑冷凍，殺死異常組織，它會脫落。

sentences.english: When the coils come off the winding machine, they are fairly loose, and delicate.
sentences.chinese: 當線圈脫落的纏繞機，它們是相當鬆散的，而微妙的。

sentences.english: You can exfoliate to help those out as well.
sentences.chinese: 您可以去角質保養，以幫助那些脫落。

sentences.english: Another fell away, shaken loose by the beating of his wings.
sentences.chinese: 另外一支在龍翼的拍打下脫落下來。

sentences.english: Two Driug's name came off the "Yangqi Tang "on Caved Stone at Nanxi mountain in Guilin.
sentences.chinese: 桂林南溪山石刻養氣湯方有二味藥名脫落。

sentences.english: A deer casts its horn in autumn.
It is from this sloughed-off land that the mud volcanoes form.
sentences.chinese: 也正是這種脫落下來的泥土形成了泥火山。

sentences.english: The author used smear from Stensen, s duct aspiration to observe exfoliated cytology in order to help diagnosis of early mumps.
sentences.chinese: 作者應用腮腺導管內吸液塗片觀察脫落細胞情況。

sentences.english: The kidney is in charge of the bones. Teeth are fixed, not to lose.
sentences.chinese: 腎主骨，牙齒固定，不至於擺動脫落。

sentences.english: The ductal system underwent atrophic changes, and thrombotic obliteration of main duct.
sentences.chinese: 導管系統上皮脫落，形成栓子阻塞導管。

sentences.english: Snapdragons, calceolaria and larkspur will drop their floret rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 金魚草，蒲包花和翠雀花的小花迅速脫落。

definition: deformation/to become deformed/to change shape/to morph
to sprout (leaves, buds, a beard etc)
to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
to wither/to dry up (of a plant)/to atrophy (of muscle, social custom etc)
